results.title: The Parallax view [NTSC]
results.brief_description: The second film in Pakula’s “paranoia” trilogy (falling between “Klute” (1971) and “All the President’s Men” (1976), is a disquieting suspense thriller that refers directly to conspiracy theories surrounding the Kennedy assassination. After a presidential candidate is assassinated, witnesses to the seemingly random crime begin dying mysteriously, including the girlfriend of a political journalist. The journalist’s investigation into the deaths uncovers a conspiracy of huge proportions that has at its centre a covert organisation known as the Parallax Corporation. He infiltrates the organisation becoming increasingly isolated and paranoid as he is drawn more deeply into its elaborate machinations. Pakula’s repeated use of opaque structures that partially obscure the screen, white-outs, off-kilter shots and disorientating editing patterns point to the impossibility of gaining access to any objective truth in this claustrophobic world where the line between reality and perception can no longer be discerned. The bleakest of the trilogy it was, unlike the other two films, a box-office failure. Cast: Warren Beatty, Hume Cronyn, William Daniels, Kenneth Mars, Walter, McGinn, Kelly Thordsen, Jim Davis.

results.title: The Paperback computer
results.creator_credit: Robert Hone, Jon Palfreman, WGBH Productions and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The dream machine”.
Explores the technological developments and the innovative research that paved the way for the Personal Computer Revolution of the 80’s. Focuses on the role hobbyists such as Steve Jobs and Stephen Wozniak (Co-founders of Apple Computer Company) played in making computers accessible with the introduction of the Macintosh in 1984. Examines the failure of companies such as Xerox and IBM to recognise potential markets outside the business and science arena and their failure to commercialise research discoveries in the 60’s and 70’s. Looks at the impact of PC’s and their extensive applications in today’s society and considers the endless possibilities for the future.

results.title: The Paper kite
results.creator_credit: National Film Board of Norway, Caprino Films, UNICEF and Ivo Caprino
results.brief_description: Depicts the dream of a Norwegian boy about the magic of UNICEF aid, in which puppets tell an entertaining and fanciful story of how UNICEF-aided projects bring hope and well-being to children all over the world.

results.title: The Pantomime dame
results.brief_description: Investigates the reasons for the Dame’s enduring hold on the audience’s imagination. It examines her function as an outrageous and aggressive parody of female behaviour and the changes in portrayal corresponding with changing social attitudes to women and sexuality. Above all the program attempts to discover why we laugh at her. Cast includes Arthur Askey, George Lacy, Duggie Byng, Paul Laidlaw, Terry Scott, Ian Evans, Jack Tripp, Victoria Wood and John Morley.

results.title: The Panda's boutique
results.creator_credit: Shanghai Meishu, British Broadcasting Corporation, Louis Elman, Shen Zuwei and Zhou Keqin
results.brief_description: A delightful Chinese animation about a family of pandas who run a boutique. Complete chaos is caused, one morning, when customers in all different shapes and sizes arrive and request some oddly shaped items.

results.title: The Panda
results.creator_credit: Shanghai Scientific and Educational Film Studio
results.brief_description: The Panda is a survivor from ancient times and now is only found in the North of China. They were almost extinct, but the care by forest rangers and the people of China has assured their survival.

results.title: The Panama Canal
results.brief_description: Traces the history of the Panama Canal, explaining how it operates and discussing its significance to world transportation. Includes scenes of a trip through the Canal and views of life in surrounding cities.

results.title: The Pale horseman
results.creator_credit: Irving Jacoby and United Nations Relief and Rehabilitation Administration
results.brief_description: Depicts health problems that follow in the wake of war, and explains how hunger and exposure have caused the spread of tuberculosis, cholera and malaria. Shows what Army doctors and UNRRA scientists have done in liberated countries to prevent the spread of epidemics.

results.title: The Painting ship
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios, Houwer Films and Franz-Josef Spieker
results.brief_description: The teachers on the Painting Ship, a floating workshop moored in the canals of Amsterdam, believe that creative artistic expression helps a child discover and develop their personality as well as become more sensitive to their cultural environment. This documentary film follows the children around as they react to the sights and sounds around them.
